function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The page shows the shopping cart overlay with two items added - the Galaxy S10 5G and the Galaxy S10+. Each item includes an image, name, price, and controls for adjusting the quantity or removing the item. The cart also offers a 'clear cart' button and a 'Checkout' button. The total price for the items in the cart is displayed at the bottom of the overlay. Outside the overlay, the main store interface is currently inaccessible, but the cart icon in the navigation bar indicates there are 2 items in the cart.","new_testing_goal":"Proceed to checkout and test the checkout process for completeness and any potential issues.","explanation":"Open the shopping cart and proceed to checkout by clicking the 'Checkout' button. This will help test the checkout process, including form submission and payment options.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":":r8:"}}

messages.content: Given a web application, you are tasked with assisting in testing its functionality. The emulate_interaction function takes an interaction as input and emulates it on the web application. The return value of the function is the new, filtered HTML source code of the web application. The source code of previous interactions will be omitted from the input to the assistant.
Here are some examples how the 'emulate_interaction' function should be used.
Please test my website: omitted

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description": "The start page of a web site with multiple calculators for different purposes. There are buttons to navigate to the differet calculators and a button to switch the language of the web site. The current language is English.", "new_testing_goal": "Test the calculator for calculating the area of a circle in multiple languages.", "explanation": "First navigate to the calculator for the area of a circle. Then input a radius and calculate the area. Switch the language of the web site and repeat the process.", "interaction": {"interaction_type": "click", "element_id": "btn-area-circle"}}

messages.content: Please test my website. The goal is to test as many different features as possible to find potential bugs, so make sure to include edge cases. Here is the filtered HTML source code of the web application: 'omitted'.

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The website appears to be an online store for Samsung products, particularly focusing on the Galaxy S10 series. There's a navigation bar at the top with links to various product categories such as Galaxy, S10, M Series, and A Series. The home page features a banner promoting the Galaxy series, along with a 'Shop now' button. Below the banner, there's a section showcasing four different models of the Galaxy S10 series - S10 5G, S10+, S10, and S10e, each with an 'add to cart' button. Additionally, there's a cart icon in the navigation bar indicating the number of items in the cart, which currently shows 0.","new_testing_goal":"Test the shopping cart functionality by adding products to the cart and checking out.","explanation":"Start by adding different Galaxy S10 models to the shopping cart to test if they're accurately added. Then, open the shopping cart to review the selected items and proceed to the checkout to evaluate the checkout process. Begin with adding the Galaxy S10 5G to the cart.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":"1:r4:"}}

messages.name: emulate_interaction
messages.content: omitted

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The page now shows the shopping cart overlay with 1 item added - the Galaxy S10 5G. It lists the product image, name, price, and quantity controls, as well as offering the option to remove the item. In the footer of the overlay, there's a total price displayed, a 'clear cart' button, and a 'Checkout' button leading to the checkout page. Navigation to different product categories is still accessible via the navigation bar.","explanation":"Continue adding different Galaxy S10 models to the cart to further test the shopping cart functionality, starting with adding the Galaxy S10+ to the cart. This will help ensure that multiple items can be successfully added and displayed within the cart.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":"2:r4:"}}

function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The shopping cart overlay is currently displayed, preventing interaction with other elements on the page. In the cart, there is one item listed: the Galaxy S10 5G, with the option to remove it or adjust its quantity. There are also buttons for clearing the cart and proceeding to checkout. The cart overlay can be closed by clicking a 'close' icon.","explanation":"Before attempting to add more products to the cart, close the shopping cart overlay to interact with other elements on the webpage. This will allow us to add more items to the cart or proceed with different actions.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":":r9:"}}

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The page now shows the main store interface without the shopping cart overlay, allowing interactions with products and the navigation bar. The page displays four Galaxy S10 models - S10 5G (already added to the cart), S10+, S10, and S10e, each with an 'add to cart' button aside from the S10 5G which is marked 'in cart'. The navigation bar includes options for various product categories such as Galaxy, S10, M Series, and A Series, and there's a banner promoting the Galaxy series. The cart icon indicates there is 1 item in the cart.","explanation":"Proceed with adding the Galaxy S10+ to the cart, then inspect the cart to ensure multiple items can be successfully added.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":"2:r4:"}}

The user provided the following end instructions: Please test my website. The goal is to test as many different features as possible to find potential bugs, so make sure to include edge cases.
Pursue your self-assigned sub-goal or assign a new one: Test the shopping cart functionality by adding products to the cart and checking out..
Previously executed interactions by goal: {"Test the shopping cart functionality by adding products to the cart and checking out.": 3}.

Start by describing the website supplied by the function call. Give a short general description first then summarize the main elements on the website. Do not use HTML in your description. Then you may formulate a high level sub-goal to the user's instructions, that should be persued with the next couple of interactions. You should formulate a new sub-goal if the current one has been completed or seems to be unattainable. Give an action plan that explains how the goal should be reached. And finally, describe the interaction to emulate.
Only use the click action with clickable elements. The clickable elements have the following ids: :r6:, :r8:, :ra:, :rb:, :r9:, :rc:, :rd:, :re:, :rf:, :rg:, :rh:, :r7:.

functions.name: emulate_interaction
functions.description: Emulates a user interaction with the web application

page_description.description: A short textual description of the state of the web application: What is the current page? What are the main elements on the page? This description should not contain any HTML.

new_testing_goal.description: Assigns a new high level sub-goal that shall be followed in order to complete the users instructions. This goal should take multiple user interactions to complete. The assistant shall try to complete this goal in the next couple of interactions and then assign a new one.

explanation.description: An action plan that explains how the goal should be reached.

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with
